metadata.title: CVE-2017-5596 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.3 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.9, the ASTERIX dissector couldgo into an infinite loop, triggered by packet injection or a malformedcapture file. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-asterix.c bychanging a data type to avoid an integer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5596` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
libwireshark11 - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
libwiretap8 - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
libwscodecs2 - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
libwsutil9 - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
tshark - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
wireshark - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
wireshark-common - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
wireshark-gtk - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
wireshark-qt - 2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.4+gcc3dc1b-1').
